greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of subsets (up to cyclic shifts) of the n-th roots of 1 with zero sum.
comment: Cyclic shifts correspond to multiplication by a root of unity.
a(n)=2 for n prime, corresponding to the empty and the full subset. [_Joerg Arndt_, Jun 10 2011]
link: Joerg Arndt, Matters Computational (The Fxtbook), section 18.4 "Sums of roots of unity that are zero", p.383
example: a(6) = 5 because these subsets add to zero: (left: as bitstring, right: subset)
xref: Cf. A103314, A110981 (counts subsets with bitstrings being Lyndon words).
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_, Aug 30 2009
ext: Terms a(40) onward from _Max Alekseyev_, Apr 08 2013
